English name: Consensus study on the ethical, legal and social implications (ELSI)
Description: Academy of Science of South Africa (ASSAf) undertook to conduct a consensus study on the ethical, legal and social implications (ELSI) of genetics and genomics work, as they relate to research, health service provision and forensic applications (medical and legal) in South Africa.
Objective(s): The purpose of this study was to provide a well-researched document based on a combination of international best practices adapted to local conditions and deliberations by the panel, that will assist the national Departments of Health and Science and Technology to draft legislation, regulations and guidelines on matters pertaining to human genetics and the human genome.
Responsible organisation(s): Academy of Science of South Africa (ASSAf;)
Policy instrument type: Regulatory oversight and ethical advice bodies
Policy instrument mini-field(s): Activities: Provide expert ethical opinion|Challenge(s) addressed: Risks to human safety, Privacy protection, Unethical use (e.g. dual-use technologies)|Reports are publicly available: Yes|Reports to: Agency / council|The coordination body is composed of: Mostly academia representatives|Type(s) of oversight or advice: Ethical principles (e.g. integrity, accountability, impartiality)
